page.title: 16CHERRY BURTON-A HOBBY
page.content: I learnt the rudiments of spinning and weaving during my training as an occupational therapist.Weaving is a particularly effective therapy but the 1st stages of spinning proved too difficult.Later the proud owner of a large black sheep,producing quantities of wool inspired my husband to construct a splendid spinning wheel and me to relearn the technique to produce an acceptable yarn for knitting Guernseys for my sailing family.Nowadays my mixed flock enables me to spin yarn in many shades.It is plyed into 2 ply on the wheel.After washing it is stretched and dried for knitting.It is satisfying to recognise members of the flock in individual garments.My ambition is to weave my own yarn on a large foot power loom, but this will have to wait until I have more time.
